name: Methi Thepla
history: Methi Thepla is a traditional Gujarati flatbread made with fresh fenugreek leaves (methi). It's a staple in Gujarati cuisine and is known for its delicious taste and health benefits.
description: Methi Thepla is a soft, flavorful flatbread made from wheat flour mixed with fenugreek leaves and spices. It's a versatile dish, often enjoyed as a breakfast item, snack, or during travels.

equipment.name: rolling pin
equipment.description: Used for rolling out the theplas.

ingredients.quantity: as required to make a soft dough

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the wheat flour, chopped fenugreek leaves, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sesame seeds, carom seeds, salt, and a little oil. Gradually add water and knead to form a soft dough.

instructions.title: Roll the Theplas
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Using a rolling pin, roll each ball into a thin, round thepla on a lightly floured surface.

instructions.title: Cook the Theplas
instructions.description: Heat a flat pan or tawa. Place a thepla on it and cook until small bubbles appear. Flip it over, apply oil, and cook until both sides are golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Methi Theplas hot with yogurt, pickle, or any chutney of your choice.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best results.
Using yogurt in the dough helps to make the theplas soft.
variations: Add grated bottle gourd (lauki) or carrots for a nutritional boost.
Spice it up with additional green chilies or garam masala.

storage.shelfLife: Methi Theplas can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container to retain freshness.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve on a traditional thali for an authentic experience.
